Here's a possible implementation of a quick sort for an integer array. subroutine quicksort(arr, low, high)
    integer, intent(inout) :: arr(:)
    integer, intent(in) :: low, high
    integer :: pivot, i, j, temp

    if (low < high) then
        pivot = arr((low + high)/2) i = low -1
        j = high +1
        do
            do
                i = i +1
                if (arr(i) >= pivot) exit
            end do
            do
                j = j -1
                if (arr(j) <= pivot) exit
            end do
            if (i >= j) exit
            ! swap
            temp = arr(i)
            arr(i) = arr(j)
            arr(j) = temp
        end do
        call quicksort(arr, low, j)
        call quicksort(arr, j+1, high)
    end

recursive subroutine quicksort(a, first, last)
  implicit none
  integer*4  a(*), x, t
  integer first, last
  integer i, j

  x = a( (first+last) / 2 )
  i = first
  j = last
  do
     do while (a(i) < x)
        i=i+1
     end do
     do while (x < a(j)) j=j-1
     end do
     if (i >= j) exit
     t = a(i);  a(i) = a(j);  a(j) = t
     i=i+1
     j=j-1
  end do
  if (first < i-1) call quicksort(a, first, i-1)

    integer, intent(inout) :: arr(:)

        call quicksort(arr, j+1, high)
